snippet: The federal courts that have reviewed the act since 2010 have found that it fails to meet the most elementary test of constitutionality.
abstract: Editorial welcomes rulings by two federal courts finding the Defense of Marriage Act to be unconstitutional; notes that Republicans lept to the law's defense after the Obama administration decided to stop enforcing it in 2011, and that since then its constitutionality has been repeatedly called into question.
lead_paragraph: The federal courts that have reviewed the act since 2010 have found that it fails to meet the most elementary test of constitutionality.

headline.print_headline: The Defense of Marriage Act, Exposed
headline.seo: The Defense of Marriage Act, Exposed
headline.main: The Defense of Marriage Act, Exposed
